class src.augmentation.Augmenter(PARAMS, img_paths, ann_paths, out_dir=None)[source]¶

Bases: object

Class load image sets at different exposures and their annotations to generate augmented images from them.

generate_aug(num_gen, r_state=1, write_img=False, start_index=0)[source]¶

To generate augmented image and annotation sets. Same augmentation is applied to a set of images and its annotation.

Parameters

  • num_gen (int) – Number of images to be generated.

  • r_state (int, optional) – Random state to select image set.

  • to 1. (Defaults) –

  • write_img (bool, optional) – Flag to write images to output folder.

  • to False. (Defaults) –

Returns

Augmented annotation set of (out_h, out_w, num_exp*3) numpy.array: Augmented annotation set of (out_h, out_w, 1)

Return type

numpy.array

src.preprocessing.get_dataset(dataset_path, num_exp=1)[source]¶

Create the image and annotation dataset from given path. Given path should contain both image and corresponding annotation. Image file as .bmp. Annotation file as .cmp

Parameters

  • dataset_path ([path]) – [Path of the image and annotation files]

  • num_exp (int, optional) – [Number of exposures of images]. Defaults to 1.

Returns

[image array, (num_img, height, width, num_exp)] [numpy.array]: [annotation array, (num_img, height, width, 1)]

Return type

[numpy.array]
